original: Evers, Knut Albert, v. konsul, Borås, f. 2/4/82 i Örby, Älvsb. 1., av disp. Albert E. o. Charlotta Börjesson. G. 08 m. Lilly Hammar. Barn: Kerstin f. 10, Al-bert 14, Ingvar 17, Knut 19. — Borås elem:lärov. 92-96, Gbgs hand :inst. 96-97. Res. i Europa o. t. USA. Anst. v. A-B Merinos 98-00, Gustaf Bergendahl i Borås 00-04, egen firma Knut Evers & Co. sed. 04, verk-st. dir. i denna. Ordf. i styr. f. A-B Borås Bank 18-42, Skand. Bankens avd:kont. i Borås sed. 42, verkst. dir. i Borås Kolimp. A-B, dir. f. A-B Borås Koksaffär, ordf. i styr. f. Fören. Kol-& Koksimp. A-B i Gbg, led. av stads-fullm. 12, drätselkamm. 18-19, led. av styr. f. De sju häradenas kulturhist. fören. i Borås o. f. Solhems sjukh. i Borås, dansk v. konsul i Borås sed. 27. Medl. av Rotarykl. RVO, RDDO.
translated: Evers, Knut Albert, Vice Consul, Borås, born on April 2, 1882 in Örby, Älvsborgs län [county], to business manager Albert E. and Charlotta Börjesson. Married in 1908 to Lilly Hammar. Children: Kerstin (born in 1910), Albert (born in 1914), Ingvar (born in 1917), Knut (born in 1919). Attended elementary school in Borås from 1892-1896, then attended trade school in Gothenburg from 1896-1897. Traveled in Europe and the United States. Worked for A-B Merinos from 1898-1900, Gustaf Bergendahl in Borås from 1900-1904, then founded his own company Knut Evers & Co. in 1904, where he served as managing director. Chairman of the board for A-B Borås Bank from 1918-1942, then for Skand. Bankens avd: kont. in Borås from 1942. Managing director of Borås Kolimp. A-B and a director for A-B Borås Koksaffär. Chairman of the board for Fören. Kol-& Koksimp. A-B in Gothenburg, served as a member of the city council from 1912 and of the council's financial committee from 1918-1919. Member of the board for De sju häradenas kulturhist. fören. in Borås and for Solhems sjukh. in Borås. Honorary Danish Vice Consul in Borås since 1927. Member of Rotarykl. RVO, RDDO.

structured.description: Knut Albert Evers (1882-04-02 - Unknown) was a Vice Consul and a prominent businessman in Borås, Sweden. He was the founding managing director of Knut Evers & Co. and held various chairman and board member positions in different companies and committees in Borås and Gothenburg.
